title.narrative: Reaching All Children with Education in Lebanon Support Project

description.narrative: The Program Development Objective is to promote equitable access to education services, enhance quality of student learning, and strengthen the education systems in Lebanon's education sector in response to the protracted refugee crisis.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Education and Higher Education

title.narrative: Timely and robust data available for evidence informed policy-making and planning

baseline.value: (i) Misalignment in data collection and data management functions across different MEHE and CERD units; (ii) data on studentenrollment not available until end of school year

target.value: (i) Data and information management framework developed and adopted by MEHE and CERD; (ii) student enrollment data by March 1st;(iii) passing rates data by August 31st.

actual.value: Student enrollment data by March 1; and (iii) pass rates data by August 31: Achieved and verified for both (RVRs 1-3 and 5).Unified data framework was formally endorsed by the Minister on March 26, 2021 and verified by the IVA

title.narrative: Percentage of trained teachers whose teaching performance meets national performance standards
Number of public schools implementing GoL-endorsed child protection policy, protocols and mechanisms
Number of public schools that conduct 2 or more health checks per year
Percentage of identified children and youth with special needs who are referred by communities for additional support
Percentage of cases of violence which were reported by communities for which referral mechanisms were followed
Percentage of schools with disaggregated data on refugee student enrolment available by 01 February of each year for current academic year
Percentage of cases of violence involving students that require follow-up/referral and for which referral mechanisms were followed
Percentage of public schools with education data management system functioning
Percentage of identified children and youth with special needs who are referred by public schools
Number of teachers, education personnel, and educators trained

target.value: Teachers : 14,500 per year;Education personnel: TBD;Educators : TBD

title.narrative: Number of public schools that implement formative and summative assessments for students in Grade 3 in reading and math
Number of public school classrooms that have received a MEHE-endorsed package of teaching materials
Number of public schools with Community Liaison Officers
Increase in the proportion of students passing their grades, and transitioning to the next grade (disaggregated by school type, grade, nationality, and gender)
Number of MEHE-owned public school buildings meeting Effective School Profile (ESP) standards equipped in line with MEHE specifications
Number of schools that implement and monitor their School Improvement Plan (SIP) within the same academic year
Number of public school buildings that meet MEHE’s Effective School Profile (ESP) standards
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Number of school aged children (3-18) enrolled in formal education
Increase in the proportion of school aged Lebanese and non-Lebanese children (3-18) enrolled in formal education (disaggregated by school type, education cycle, nationality, and gender)
Number of public schools newly built or expanded to meet quality standards specified in GoL’s Decree 9091
Number of public school buildings (by MEHE owned/rented) furnished in line with MEHE specifications
Number of children and youth whose registration fees for public formal education and ALP are partially or fully subsidized

title.narrative: % of children and youth aged 03-15 above the corresponding graduation age who have completed a Cycle
CERD adequately capacitated and equipped to develop interactive content and e-platform
Endorsed framework for school-based management operational
National Teacher Assessment Framework and teacher observation tools developed and operational
Curriculum revised to improve quality of learning
National textbooks piloted, evaluated, and finalized for print
Annual RACE II Operational and Financial Plan and Report available
CERD Annual Statistics Yearbook is published by 01 August every year for the last academic year (inclusive of all refugee-educationdata)
Comprehensive national learning assessment strategy developed and operational
Document on Risk Screening of Public Schools in Lebanon under the National School Safety Program (NSSP) available
Mid-cycle and end-cycle RACE II program review completed
Policy and mechanisms to monitor violence against children in schools endorsed and operationalized by MEHE (with MOSA, MOJ, MOI)
Policy framework for special needs education endorsed and operational
Quality control standards for planning, procurement and financial management for PMU and CERD endorsed and operational
Staffing review and technical assistance plan for PMU, CERD, and DOPS available
Unified framework for data management, data collection protocols, and compliance systems endorsed and operational
RACE II coordination platform led by PMU established and fully functional
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
